description: From Middle English hwny pott; equivalent to honey +‎ pot.

definitionGroups.group: (figuratively) Something or someone similarly sweet or enticing, particularly:

entries.meaning: (US slang, dated) A romantic pet name; "honey".
(espionage) A spy (typically attractive and female) who uses sex to trap and blackmail a target.
examples: And the American Embassy in Moscow was infiltrated thanks to “honeypots,” Soviet women who seduced Marine guards.

entries.meaning: A woman who attracts sexual attention from men.
(computer security) A trap set to detect or deflect attempts at unauthorized use of information systems.
examples: Computer experts install honeypots to trick hackers.

entries.meaning: (chiefly Britain) A draw: a place which attracts visitors.
examples: Superb Roman remains, Georgian architecture and countless museums justify Bath's position as a tourist honeypot.
